title: Quiz 4: The Foetal Skull
description: Assessment of foetal skull bones, sutures, fontanelles, and diameters.

questions.question: The Anterior Fontanelle is also known as ___BLANK___ and is ___BLANK___ shaped.
questions.explanation: The Bregma is the large, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle.

questions.question: Match the foetal skull suture with its location:

pairs.right: Separates occipital bone from parietal bones
Lies between the two parietal bones
Separates frontal bones from parietal bones
Runs between the two halves of the frontal bone

questions.hint: Sagittal means arrow/straight down the middle.

questions.question: What is the measurement of the Sub-occipitobregmatic diameter (the presenting diameter in a well-flexed vertex)?
questions.explanation: The Sub-occipitobregmatic diameter is the smallest (9.5 cm) and favorable for delivery.
questions.hint: It is the smallest antero-posterior diameter.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe the alteration in the shape of the foetal head (overlapping of bones) during passage through the birth canal?
questions.explanation: Moulding is the compression and overlapping of skull bones to facilitate birth.

questions.question: Which diameter is measured between the two parietal eminences?
questions.explanation: The Biparietal diameter (9.5 cm) is the widest transverse diameter of the foetal head.

questions.question: The Mentovertical diameter (Brow presentation) is the longest diameter of the foetal skull at 13.5 cm.
questions.explanation: The Mentovertical diameter is 13.5 cm and usually results in an obstructed labor if persistent.
questions.hint: It goes from the chin to the vertex.

questions.question: Which intracranial structures may be damaged by excessive moulding? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Excessive moulding tears the dural folds (Falx, Tentorium) and can rupture venous sinuses causing hemorrhage.
questions.hint: Think about the membranes inside, not the hard bones.
